alert.note: Alert for Crane; Pecos; Reagan; Reeves; Terrell; Upton; Ward (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued March 17 at 3:17PM CDT until March 17 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Pecos County in southwestern Texas... Southeastern Reeves County in southwestern Texas... Southeastern Ward County in western Texas... Reagan County in western Texas... Central Crane County in western Texas... Northeastern Terrell County in southwestern Texas... Upton County in western Texas... * Until 445 PM CDT. * At 316 PM CDT, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 22 miles west of Fort Stockton to 16 miles southwest of McCamey, moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...Less than three miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. Visibilities may be locally reduced to below one mile. SOURCE...Satellite. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes Interstate 10 between mile markers 221 and 327. Locations impacted include... Fort Stockton, Crane, Big Lake, McCamey, Rankin, Sheffield, Grandfalls, Reagan County Airport, Iraan, Imperial Reservoir, Upton County Airport, Bakersfield, Girvin, Royalty, Firestone Test Track, Iraan Municipal Airport, Best, Stiles, Fort Stockton-Pecos County Airport and Coyanosa. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.

area.areaDesc: Crane; Pecos; Reagan; Reeves; Terrell; Upton; Ward
